title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, December 3, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss tells his wife of skirmishing, the retreat of the Union troops and their horrific treatment of civiliams. He relates miscellaneous news about himself, and comments on that from home.
keywords: Home Front, Battle Description, Prisons/Prisoners, Women, Slavery, African Americans, Troop Movement, Military Authority, Family, Desertion/Leave, American Civil War
